result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:31 AM Defendant Chandler J Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Chandler J Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court was notified the defendant is refusing to come to Court today.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Search Warrant Executed on 09-28-2022 - Apple iPhone
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A & C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

ADDITIONAL CONDITION:  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:54 AM Defendant Chandler J Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Chandler J Smith.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Andrea M Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Court amends bond conditions.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:40 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Chandler J Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller in court for Chandler J Smith. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
